intro: Cynophalla retusa, commonly known as the smooth cynophalla, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in clusters, making it a notable ornamental plant in gardens.
